examples.text: Cristiano Ronaldo dos Santos Aveiro was born on 5 February 1985 in Portugal. He plays for Al Nassr and the Portugal national team. Ronaldo has won five Ballon d'Or awards and three UEFA Men's Player of the Year Awards.

Apple Inc. was founded by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne on April 1, 1976. The company is headquartered in Cupertino, California and is known for products like the iPhone, MacBook, and iPad.
The Eiffel Tower was completed on March 31, 1889 in Paris, France. It was designed by Gustave Eiffel and is visited by around 7 million people every year.
The World Health Organization (WHO) declared COVID-19 a pandemic on March 11, 2020. The virus was first identified in Wuhan, China in December 2019.
Amazon.com was founded by Jeff Bezos on July 5, 1994. The company started as an online bookstore but has expanded to sell almost everything. Its headquarters are in Seattle, Washington.

The 2024 Summer Olympics, officially the Games of the XXXIII Olympiad, is scheduled to take place from July 26 to August 11, 2024, in Paris, France. The city was selected as the host in September 2017 at the 131st IOC Session in Lima, Peru. The Games will mark Paris's third time hosting the Olympics (1900 and 1924), making it the second city (after London) to host the Games three times. The event will feature 32 sports across 329 events, with breaking (breakdancing) making its Olympic debut. The Games will use 35 venues, including iconic locations like the Eiffel Tower for beach volleyball and the Palace of Versailles for equestrian events. Tony Estanguet, a three-time Olympic champion in canoe slalom, serves as the President of the Paris 2024 Organizing Committee. The Olympic Village, located in Saint-Denis, will house approximately 14,500 athletes and officials. The Paralympics will follow from August 28 to September 8, 2024. The mascots for the Games are Phryges, anthropomorphic Phrygian caps colored in the French tricolor of blue, white, and red, symbolizing freedom and the French Revolution.
